item.title: Check out Mars tonight: It's closer to Earth than it has been in 11 years
item.description:
Check out Mars tonight: It's closer to Earth than it has been in 11 years

As you wind down from your Memorial Day festivities tonight, take a minute to find Mars glowing yellow and bright in the eastern sky. On the evening of May 30, the Red Planet will come closer to Earth than it has in 11 years.

item.title: No title
After 4,600 years, we can finally see deep inside Egypt's mysterious pyramids
item.description:
After 4,600 years, we can finally see deep inside Egypt's mysterious pyramids

You may have wondered what the inside of a pyramid looks like. Not the cavities and passages you see on "The Mummy" - the actual structure of the creation, how it was built to last all these years. The pyramids of ancient Egypt are about 4,500 years old.

item.title: The fabulous fossils of Messel - a colourful world of birds and beetles
item.description:
The fabulous fossils of Messel - a colourful world of birds and beetles

something as fragile as a butterfly survives crushing forces of nature...

item.title: Wind, Cold, and Altitude Sickness: Winter at the South Pole
item.description:
Wind, Cold, and Altitude Sickness: Winter at the South Pole

Right now, a daring rescue mission is racing against time and harsh conditions to save a sick worker at the South Pole. Dangerous winds, punishing cold, and round-the-clock darkness make flights to Antarctica extremely rare at this time of year.

item.title: 10 mind-blowing facts about black holes
item.description:
10 mind-blowing facts about black holes

I really don't believe I would want to be anywhere near such a phenomenal galactic event...

item.title: No title
Hubble's View of a Galactic Gathering
item.description:
Hubble's View of a Galactic Gathering

Makes you feel kind of small and insignificant...but physics says we are all connected.

item.title: The First Official Climate Refugees in the U.S. Race Against Time
item.description:
The First Official Climate Refugees in the U.S. Race Against Time

A shot rings out across what remains of Isle de Jean Charles as the sun drops behind the gnarled skeletons of what once were massive oak trees. Rifle in hand, Howard Brunet, 14, stands on the deck of his uncle's stilted house looking down at the rabbit he shot on the far edge of the property.
